Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery phiale mesomphalos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; traces of faded lotus flower and bud with some added red and added white preserved; exterior: undetermined decoration around rim; below, lotus and bud chain.
Curator's comments: Lemos identifies this sherd as belonging to the group of vases with floral decoration in the Simple Animal Style. The lotus flower and lotus bud pattern found on these vessels appears on the exterior surface of the vases and in the later vases the pattern resembles that found on Fikellura vases such as on this vase. For parallels with Fikellura patterns, see Oxford AN1925.608b(9) For parallels, see British Museum 1924,1201.26.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 132, p. 308, no. 1267)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1981) (phase 2)
